Democritus is a science editorial website aimed at engaging more people in learning basic science and having a better online reading experience.

Type
Individual course project
Deliverables
Prototypes (Desktop & mobile);
Interaction Demos;
Timeline
2019-10-07 - 2019-10-20

People don't reading science content online.

Science becomes boring when you have to read a long paper discussing some unfamiliar knowledgement word by word.

The problem I identified for current science editorial websites is a lack of attraction and motivation for people to engage in reading science content as well as keep revisiting the sites.

User groups
" As a college student, I want to quickly document and organize the information that is useful for me, so that I can take away for my future references.
" As a high school student, I want to find out what a scientist's work looks like, so that I can think about whether I'd like to choose it as my career.
" As a high school teacher, I want to browse interesting science-related materials, so that I can use them as my teaching resources.
Take-away: Shape, color and contrast can be used to add visual interests as well as differentiate categories / themes.
#1 Competitive website: Aggregate
Take-away: Add-ons such as “Fact of the day”, illustrations, mouseover (screen tips) can be used to make content more engaging and easy-to-digested.
#2 Competitive website: Supercluster
Take-away: In-text citation and clear figure annotation can gain trust from audiences by showing professionalism.
#3 Competitive website: Aggregate
Take-away: Brief summaries and usage of anchor links increase auidences' reading efficiency.
#4 Competitive website: SmashingMagzine

How can I keep audiences scrolling.

  • Create curiosity: design a weekly spotlight on controversial issues and disccusion forum;
  • Fill the gap: design a scientists' blog section about their stories and industry insights;
  • Set up challenge: design a science quiz questions section;
  • Build sense of achievement: design a note-taking widget on the post page.
Information Architecture
Exploring possible layout of key screens

Decisions on website structure

"Create curiosity" is the priority goal in this project, therefore, weekly spotlight, or to say the discussion forum section should be prioritized to draw users' attention at the first glance.

Adjust site layout for mobile platform.

  • Menu items: change the navigation bar to a hamburger menu due to a limited width of mobile screen;
  • Article Collection: use sliding room instead of four columns grid to present recommended articles;
  • Comments: use card layout to seperate each comment clearlier for mobile users.

Introduce to
Note-taking Mode.

Note-taking mode is a new function I designed for "building a sense of achievement". It allows users to take notes while reading with easy operations.
It provides four tools including:


  • Direct Selection;
  • Free Selection;
  • Review Notes;
  • Download Notes.
Note-taking Mode Walkthrough
A sidebar slides in from the right of the screen when the mode is on.

( From top to bottom )
Direct Selection allows users to drag & drop any sentences or images within the post; While Free Selection let users select one or multiple words or phrases; Review Notes allows users to check & edit their notes; Download Notes downloads all notes users have been taken within this post into their default folder.

What have I learned

Behavioral observation is a great tool to understand user's mind. Through analyzing my own online reading behavior and observing other two participants' reactions when they are visiting science website, I summarized that curiosity, storytelling and challenges play a role in keeping people scrolling as well as encourage them to revisit.
